text: Great location by the ocean with comfortable bedding. The staff is mostly untrained and would do things such as knock on my door at 8am and then do landscaping super early, tell me all sorts of things that were unprofessional. The standout of the stay was the night manager Yopi who was nothing short of SPECTACULAR. Super hardworking, attentive, kind. He listened to my issues, solved problems that came up, and honestly saved the day on multiple occasions. The best part is that he's new at the resort. Having stayed at places like the Four Seasons, Intercontinental, Park Hyatt, etc. around the world - I can say that his service is 5 star. He really made sure things ran smoothly, and was super responsive to all of my needs.

text: The location is one of the best parts about this place. It's away from all the traffic, crowds and noise. The surf out front is perfect and uncrowded. The rooms are really pretty and look brand new. While it seems that the staff are perhaps also new and will pick up on the finer details in time, they were all absolutely lovely. The GM Sony was in contact via WhatsApp and made us feel that he would take care of any issues should they arise. Given the location, I was ready for the in house menu to be quite expensive (because where else are you going to go?), but it was all quite reasonable (and delicious!). All in all, as with many places in Bali, come here with a relaxed mentality and you will be perfectly happy. If your breakfast omelette gets forgotten, well, have another smoothie and enjoy the view while the smiley staff fix the minor mistake!
title: Surf, smiley staff and a great view!

text:
Me, my wife and 2 children (9 & 16 yo boys) stayed here for 3 nights in Family tent. This was our first time in life to stay in tent . Firstly was so excited. .. 
About 2 hours from kuta area (with traffic jam)  to this secluded place. A small road around 500m before entering this hidden place.... 
You can see the tents from this small and heavy road....and then... amazed... 
Check in process were fast. They gave us 1 room key... not card key... and the staff brought our luggages using the troley..and he guided us from the front to the back area , which our family tent placed, near the beach. 
Our tent is a family tent. 1 king size bed and 2 single bed.. all are king koil brand , very comfort and clean.. the shower with very good cold and hot water... no problem at all
We had our welcome drink (very tasty ) in restaurant, exactly in front of the beach....near the infinity pool
The staffs in restaurant were amazing.... super kind and very helpfull. We had dinner in this restaurant..the dinner food was delicious... a bit pricey....
Unfortunately we had a bit storm, windy hard rain on our first night... 
The next morning, they moved the restaurant to the other big tent .
Me and my child had a good experience using the infinity pool, the view of the ocean direct in front of us were amazing....they prepare towel beside the pool. 
Actually i plan to have picnic breakfast the next day, but i canceled due to the waether and in my opinion the breakfast was so so.... just ordinary american breakfast with some indonesian cuisine choices. 
If i want to return to this place, i might choose the summer time
title: First experience in luxury glamping

text:
Please take sometime to read my full review on "Bali Beach Glamping". Here are my review/chronology from reservation to check out. 

I made a reservation through their official website. I then reserve a deluxe tent and went on to look for more information on what activities was available. I came across 'BBQ dinner' and 'Picnic Breakfast'. I contacted the whatsapp number provided on the website and tried to book both activities. Shockingly, instead of fulfilling my request, they instead gave me a number (Pak Carmante, SPV F&B) and asked me to contact MYSELF. 

Question: Should the reservation actually coordinate with the F&B and get back to me OR should i get thrown a number and contact myself? 

Few days passed, i have not contacted and NONE from Bali Beach Glamping contacted me. I was pretty disappointed on this issue. I finally took the initiative to contact Pak Carmante and he arranged all well for us (Couple looking for a new fresh retreat). Pak Carmante took the effort to inform on the best time for the set up and i appreciate for that. 

CHECK-IN :

We arrived on 9th July on the hotel. Had a luggage with us, we arranged our check in and we were told to please wait while the Bel-boy would bring our luggage for us and walk us to our tent. However, no bel-boy came to take the luggage. Thus, my partner and i took the luggage and walked to the tent OURSELVES without knowing where to go. No one stopped or gave attention to us. While we were walking, bel-boy walked passed and DID NOT offer to take our luggage or escort us to our tent. 

BBQ Dinner & Picnic Breakfast : 

Everything was arranged nicely and we would like to give a HUGE HUGE shoutout for Yanas, who served us during our stay. He is such a professional and well trained. Very communicative with the guest too. I give him 2 huge thumbs up. Without Yanas, our stay would not be so good. Thank you Yanas for your wonderful service. 

Special mention: Thank you pak carmante and pak ketut for coming to our table and greet us. Very much appreciated. 

Conclusion: 
We will still reccomend our friends and family to come and have a try but sadly, we do not think we will come back again. we do not expect a 5 star hotel service but we also do not expect a well below par service either. More training is needed for people working there (especially FO). Hospitality is everything in this industry and i hope for the best for 'Bali Beach Glamping'. 

Ciao.
title: Review on Bali Beach Glamping

owner_response.text:
Dear Nicco,
Thank you for taking the time to share your valuable feedback regarding your most recent stay at Bali Beach Glamping. While we strive to provide impeccable service and quality of products for all our guests – your feedback is valuable for our continuous improvement as it assists us in evaluating how we can better serve our valued guests and in identifying those areas where additional efforts should be directed.

Whilst we are happy to hear that there were some redeemable aspects of your vacation which we do hope would coerce you to stay with us once again at Bali Beach Glamping, as the precious time afforded to one on a vacation is extremely valuable, it is with regret and concern to read that your stay with us was not an overall enjoyable one as the vast majority of guests’ experience.

Our continued aim is to exceed our guests’ expectations, and I sincerely apologize that this may not have happened on this rare occasion.
Yana is one of the best waiters in Bali Beach Glamping and thanks to him for making your memorable. He was incredibly happy to hear your recognition. 
Needless to say, We are saddened that you would not choose to return to Bali Beach Glamping, and do hope that you will give us another opportunity in the future. Again, count on us to take your feedback on board and seek how we can learn from your experiences as we aim to continually improve and enhance our offering and service delivery.

Please know that our glamping will always be open for you and if ever I can assist in the future, please do not hesitate to reach out; it will be a pleasure to assist.

Best Regard,
Ricky and BBG Team

text:
This place is soo beautiful and unique. The beds are amazingly comfortable I stayed in a deluxe tent which was lovely and a bit bigger than the basic tents. And you can hear the ocean at night, feels like you are right on the beach.
When you walked outside of your tent everyone was taking photos or videos as this place is so beautiful. Pool is fantastic but only has a few lounge chairs.
Restaurant was a bit hit and miss with the food some dishes where great and others average but reasonably priced. Breakfast was ok but wish they offered more. You could purchase more off the menu for breakfast. 
Water is provided in the room shame it is not provided free of charge at the restaurant.
Sunsets from the restaurant are amazing and watching surfers in the morning is fantastic. 
They give you a whatsapp number when checking in so you can contact them anytime with queries.
A shame they didn't plan the spa location better it is located right next to reception and in a tent (the same as the accommodation). So you hear all the noise from reception and have aircon but the tent is open so seems like a waste. 

They had a big group staying on the last night, doing tik toks outside tents at night and the next day where making alot of noise and playing games in the pool and playing music. Would have been good if they took into consideration of other guests. I did ask if possible to check out a little later and was told no but saw they weren't cleaning the room till 2pm. Which was a disappointing. 
Staff's english is very limited and a bit challenging at reception, i did ask about a rate to extend stay and was told alot higher rate than booking direct online.
This is such a beautiful unique place that i hope stays like this for many return visits.
title: Paradise

owner_response.text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for having taken the time to share your feedback with us. All feedback is helpful and serves as both an inspiration to the team to keep our extra efforts up as well as a motivation in finding room for growth and improvement.
It is of course wonderful to read that you appreciated the room facility and environment as you shared earlier. 
We do apologize for your dining and breakfast experiences we have addressed the matter to our Food and Beverage Team and we will improve it. 
We shall certainly take your feedback on board and see if additional English classes for the team are helpful. As you may know, we will create a program with an English teacher on the team and she will be delighted to see what specific additional language training we can offer.
In the line with an event during your stay, we do apologize that you were disturbed in your tent by nearby people and wish you would have flagged that to us so we could have addressed it with the guests in question.
We appreciate your feedback on The SPA location, we have a plan in the future to move The SPA with a better atmosphere to create an excellent spa experience in the line we will build more rooms, a Yoga Sala, and a Hemmingway Lounge in the front of the lawn.
In addition, we provide one liter of a bottle of refill water and two bottles of mineral water in the room with free refill during your stay and you are able to refill in the restaurant. What we will charge if you order Aqua Still or sparkling water from the restaurant. 
Through valued feedback, we continue to develop our guest experience and would look forward to the opportunity of your return again in the future.
Please feel free to contact me at ricky@balibeachglamping.com when we may be able to arrange your next visit or if the BBG team or I can be of any further assistance until then and we would look forward to serving you again.

Best Regard,

Ricky and Bali Beach Glamping

text:
Bali Beach Glamping is one of the most relaxing places I have ever stayed in .My husband does not like going away and usually wants to leave before breakfast and spend minimal time in any resort. He relaxed into our 2 days stay like nothing I have ever seen before in 10 years of marriage. 
Food and beverage and the staff are wonderful. Prices are surprisingly reasonable compared to other places we have been to. 
Spa is really well priced and so are the activities.
If you are looking to slow down and catch your breath, this is the place to be. Luxury and camping combined, room was amazing, we stayed in the Deluxe Standard room.

text:
What a wonderful experience!
At the very start of our booking, the communication with Bali Beach Glamping was excellent. They were able to organise a bottle of wine in our room on arrival and supplied us with a list of activities that we could book during our stay.

At check-in, the staff were very knowledgeable and had even informed the chef/kitchen of my dietary requirements (gluten-free due to coeliac disease). The chef was wonderfully accommodating and professional, coming out to speak to me each meal time to discuss the ingredients with me and tailor the food to my needs. After living in Bali for 6 years, this is some of the most impressively attentive service I have received and I really appreciate it!

My husband and I were very impressed with the Dulux tent which was beautifully set-out. Lots of little touches make this a very enjoyable 'camping' experience and the bed is ridiculously comfortable. The sound of crashing waves was nice to hear whilst falling asleep, although rooms further away from the ocean can be chosen if you'd rather not have that to listen to.

Lastly, I'd like to say a big thank you to the staff - they are amazing! So attentive and they make a point to know your name and greet you personally each time they see you. It's the little touches like that, that make such a big difference. 

I would certainly recommend Bali Beach Glamping to those who want something a bit different to a regular night in a hotel. We shall certainly be back!
title: Glamping with style

text:
Hubby and I have recently moved to Bali and for his birthday getaway he chose Bali beach Glamping. And it certainly did not disappoint! We had the most amazing 2 night stay here in our deluxe ocean view room (one of only 2!) And we loved everything about our stay and will be back! We ate and drank to our hearts content, including upgrading his birthday breakfast to a floating basket breakfast and partaking in the sunset BBQ dinner! Both thoroughly exceeded our expectations! 
There are 4 different tent options here, all with air conditioning and own bathroom. Deluxe ocean view, deluxe, family tents and smaller outpost tents. Our deluxe ocean view tent was the most expensive but still very affordable! 
I would thoroughly recommend Bali beach Glamping for a unique and special stay. Thankyou for making our weekend such a memorable one 🙏
title: Incredible birthday Glamping weekend

text:
Really had a great time at Bali Beach Glamping.
Took us only about 30mnts from Canggu to get there.
The place was really nice and clean, all staff is polite and friendly too.

I stayed at Deluxe Tent, it was pretty spacious with excellent tent materials. Equipped with their wooden accent bathroom, even the closet is wooden. Their toothbrush is made of wood too, eco-friendly material.
I also love their working desk with the stylist chair.
The tent itself can be opened on every side, like real camping!
They provide us with 2 bottles of mineral water, a minibar with a fridge, and a safety box too.
My favorite spot of this tent is the swing. The size is big enough and comfortable too.

Walking down the glamping area, we can found another big swing and hammock near the rice field. The rice field is also nice and pretty.

BBG has an infinity pool facing the ocean where we can watch a beautiful sunset. Their restaurant is just next to the pool and the price is really affordable. I ordered pizza and beer, and it was good.

There is also another area for a party or wedding or gathering. But we can play a mini soccer game when it's not occupied. Oh, they also have Jenga near the pool where our kids can play too.

Overall we had a great experience staying at Bali Beach Glamping.
title: Amazing Glamping with Rice Field and Ocean Views!

text: My girlfriend and I stayed at Bali Beach Glamping and absolutely loved it. The glamping tent was beautiful and felt like a luxury hotel room in a safari tent. The food and drinks was great too and the staff was so helpful. I definitely recommend this place, the price felt like a steal for such a unique resort. Doing the bonfire and S'mores brought me back to my childhood. Only thing that could be a little better was the dinner service could have been a little faster. Bali time! This is something special!

text:
Well, stayed in a family-sized-tent. The aircon wont let you get warm, so cold! haha
I stayed here with 4 others family members, they gave us one extra bed for us for free!
The price i paid aint include the breakfast, cmiiw, breakfast cost 50k rupiah/person. 
the breakfast menu was standard, toast or nasi goreng with fruits and tea/coffee/juice.
They have infinity pool and direct access to the public beach.
The room or tent also clean and neat. There's also refrigerator, i mean, really refrigerator with cold mineral water inside, while some other hotel's refrigerator sometimes not that cold.
Because we stayed in a tent, there's posibilities some animals get in our tent, like frog or insects, in my experience it didnt really matter because they didnt distrub us while sleeping.
I think they need to improve the shower power and breakfast menu.
All the staff are really friendly.
title: My 1st Glamping Moment

text:
The stay was great. View amazing. beach great. Nice pool. Friendly staff. Room was good (outpost tent). Some issues to fix:

We had 2 tents. One of them had an air conditioner that wasn’t working well. Service for food was slow. Also slow was sorting out the bill. So after check out there was another bill that they were slow to collect. This Rp80k bill was then chased up aggressively by asking all the other guests where we were and why we hadn’t settled our bill. which I didn’t appreciate. Happened to a few other folks too. 

I get the feeling that the owners are trying to maximise profit which can come with these sort of issues. 

Also coffee machine broke. 

That all said, the location was great and we will probably be back.
title: Could improve a couple of things
